paper.title: A note on a partial ordering for communication channels

author.org: Center for Advanced Study in the Behavioral Sciences, Stanford, California, USA

paper.abstract: A partial ordering is defined for discrete memoryless channels. It is transitive and is preserved under channel operations of addition and multiplication. The main result proved is that if K1 and K2 are such channels, and K1 âŠ‡ K2, then if a code exists for K2, there exists at least as good a code for K1, in the sense of probability of error.
